intro: Mesembryanthemum minusculum, commonly known as the small evening primrose, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family and is characterized by its fleshy, succulent leaves and showy, yellow flowers that bloom in the evening. The plant is adapted to arid environments, with a compact growth form and a deep root system to conserve water. Its flowers are typically short-lived, opening at dusk and closing by morning. Mesembryanthemum minusculum is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and ability to thrive in well-drained soils.
